content:
Configure Your Einstein Classification Model

Decide which closed cases Einstein learns from, and choose the fields that you want Einstein to predict.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Einstein Case Classification is available in Salesforce Classic and Lightning Experience. Setup for Einstein Case Classification is available only in Lightning Experience.

USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To build and manage Einstein Case Classification: View Setup, Customize Application, Manage Profiles and Permission Sets, Edit on cases OR Modify All Data.

To create a model, click Get Started or New Model on the Einstein Classification setup page.
Select an app and enter a name for your model. Click Next.
Decide the type of cases for your model to focus on. If you want, define a segment of cases to limit which closed cases Einstein learns from and which new cases get predictions.

If you want, define additional criteria to identify example cases for Einstein to learn from.
Add the fields that you want Einstein to predict.
Address any warning or error messages and make sure that you have enough data.

Click Finish and move on to building your model. Your new model appears on the Einstein Classification setup page.

Considerations for Choosing Fields to Predict
When you create your Einstein classification model, you select the fields that Einstein predicts. Follow our guidelines when choosing fields.
title: Configure and Optimize Einstein Case Classification
